Elliott - 

You missed a nice weekend. I hear the show was once again a sel=
l-out show with loads of goodies to fondle at all the tables. 

What I enjo=
yed so very much was the talks and exhibits that were presented. Gordon Rob=
son (NTHK) presented an interesting exhibit and talk on swords and fittings=
 from Mino province which was quite educational. Then there was a wonderful=
 exhibit presented by Bob Benson and the NBTHK-American branch on "tanto." =
Around twenty fine tanto were laid out for our study showing the changes in=
 form and treatment over the centuries. This was quite educational, to see =
Kamakura work and then Muromachi and later, Muromachi copies of Kamakura wo=
rks. 

Then there was a super exhibit of fittings entitled "Machibori" whic=
h was assembled and presented by Mike Yamasaki. Unbelievable quality of fit=
tings were represented! As Mike pointed out, the name "Machibori" is taken =
(outside of Japan) as more common "street carver's work" when in reality, i=
t does not mean "lower quality" work at all. The items exhibited and explai=
ned in Mikes illustrated catalogue (in color) were super in quality and car=
ried many famous names. 

The NBTHK-American branch also held a kantei sess=
ion for members laying out four blades for our judgment, always a challenge=
!!!

It was simply a great weekend. Saturday's banquet for tableholders was=
 yummy and appreciated, judging from the overflowing plates some guys carri=
ed away. The unfortunate part of the weekend was that the hotel was under c=
onstruction as they remodeled the lobby bar/first floor area. It was a mess=
!!! However, everyone adapted quickly and the temporary bar area (in the ca=
sual restaurant area) was full of merrymakers at the end of the evening aft=
er the show closed at ten. Fun times!

Ron
STL

  I missed t=
he SF show and feel really bad. Who ever attended, tell me 
  what I missed=
. What were the lectures about? Robson, Gilbert, Benson, 
  and others give=
 great classes. I promise never to miss another show. It 
  hurts too bad!
=

  Elliott
